page.title: 03Transport through Ilford.
page.content: The High Road, which bisects the area, closely follows the route of the old {Roman road}which linked London to Colchester. During the 18th and early 19th century, it became an important mail and stage coach route. In 1839, the{Eastern Counties Railway extended their line from London through the area. In 1862, this became part of the{Great Eastern Railway}and at the end of the last century, stations were built to serve the new housing estates at Seven Kings, Goodmayes and Chadwell Heath. The Central Line of the London {Underground system}reaches Newbury Park and the area is well served by a dense network of London Transport {bus}services. Despite all this, car usage is increasing rapidly and traffic congestion is a major problem in the area. MAYFIELD HIGH SCHOOL
